snippet: Resuming relations with Cuba fit a recent pattern of aggressiveness by the president, whose cautiousness had led some allies to accuse him of abandoning his principles.
abstract: News analysis; Pres Obama's decision to shift United States policy toward Cuba represents most striking example of his abandonment of hesitancy that defined his first six years in office; Obama's aggressive, unilateral action has drawn criticism from his political opponents, while others see new pattern as return to his original principals.
lead_paragraph: Resuming relations with Cuba fit a recent pattern of aggressiveness by the president, whose cautiousness had led some allies to accuse him of abandoning his principles.

headline.main: For Obama, More Audacity and Fulfillment of Languishing Promises
headline.print_headline: U.S.Penalizes Companies for Providing Fuel to Syrian Forces
